name: City Garden Hotel Hong Kong

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the City Garden (Business) hotel, arriving on the 19th July and checking out on the 23rd July this year.
reviews.title: Reasonably Comfortable but has a Foreigner Price mentality !
Not honest....
reviews.text: First impressions, the hotel looks great from the outside, the door staff were freindly, and taxi's are easily obtaininable from the hotel forecourt entrance, the hotel is located very nicely near the Fortress Hill MTR stop, its about a 5 minute walk crossing a busy intersection, and up on the right, convenient for those who buy the 3 day tourist pass with Airport express journeys.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checking in, the Reception staff seemed a bit flat in terms of welcome, however, we checked in and were given a room on the 9th floor.
reviews.title: highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room on first inspection was quite big, we had booked a triple, and we found 3 well made up beds available, the bathroom was marble, good facilities, and the best set of amenities I have ever seen in a hotel in my life, in this one, they had put razors and shaving cream in small packets, something of a welcome, if you had not brought any shaving cream, it did the job and was a big boost to our first impressions.
reviews.title: really liked city garden in hong kong

likes.liked: — cleanliness, central and close to tube and tram

reviews.text: Sadly, the Aircon was a big let down, after staying in the Ramada Des Voeux road on a previous stay, with a fantastic room divided into a suite and bedroom area, with superb aircon, this aircon system was a big let down.
reviews.title: Good service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were shown two rooms at this hotel and they both stank to high heavens! The brown carpets and brown brillo pad type blankets were disgusting, the smell stuck to the back of your throat. We booked through a booking agency which waxed lyrical about the garden view, all we saw was a derelict fountain opposite. The beds are like jelly, so one to avoid if you have back problems. We arrived and after seeing a standard and executive room checked out immediately cancelling our booking with the hotel.
reviews.title: Very, very disappointing

likes.disliked: — The appalling smelling rooms and beds that needed renewing

reviews.text: This Hotel in Hong Kong is a Four Star establishment, in an advanced country. I have never been to a four star establishment that does not vacuum carpets, or change bed linen before, so this was a first! The carpet was black and looks like it has never been cleaned since it was first laid; the linen is not changed but just shook and replaced on the bed. Our child was covered in bites from bed bugs and we all developed a skin rash due to the amount of dust mites living with us in the room. We were constantly itching whilst trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Bedbugs!

likes.disliked: — sharing my bed with bedbugs and fleas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A word of advice, if you want to have clean towels everyday make sure you put all your used or unused towels in the bath and WET THEM! So they have to give you new ones. Also if there are three of you in a room i.e. parents and a child, you are only given enough towels and bath accessories for two people, and are not likely to get a third set unless you ring housekeeping to remind them EVERY DAY!
reviews.title: Wet

likes.liked: — It was close to our friend's flat.
likes.disliked: — It was wet, and I was angry about the charge for the water.

reviews.title: Comfortable stay at City Garden
reviews.text: There was one day when the room wasn’t made up at all until we complained.

And if you fancy a light breakfast, go somewhere outside of the hotel as their breakfast is £10.00 per head regardless of age, so if you have children that only want a couple of spoonfuls of cereal it’s the same price, unless you can eat your way through £10.00 worth of breakfast a day don’t bother. And by the way the breakfast choice is fairly limited and nothing to write home about, try Starbucks there seems to be one on every corner in Gateway or Central.
reviews.title: A good value base for exploring HK

likes.disliked: — location not so great in terms of local attractions, but local transport links (MTR) excellent.

reviews.text: After seeing the poor reviews here, we went with low expectations. But surprisingly, it turned out to be a pleasant stay. We were upgraded to Club Room. Think it was one of the recently renovated rooms. Clean and comfortable. The hotel is also convenient as MTR station is just a couple of minutes away, and there is also complimentary bus shuttle services provided by hotel to shopping district and the Central stationl, where the airport express is. The check in and check out was also fast and smooth for us.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay and very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on our trip to Asia, we arrived at the hotel at midnight and it took 25 minutes to check in. When finally getting checked in they asked myself and my husband if a room with two single beds were ok. We said no and said that our booking confirmation stated that we had a deluxe double room booked. He said this was not a problem and booked us into a room with a double bed. Finally getting to the room we discovered that the main light in the room did not work and with it being about night time we could not see to unpack. We contacted reception who after waiting 10 minutes sent an maintanance guy to sort the light. He confirmed after 15 minutes that there was a problem with electrics and started to try and sort this out, by now it was about 1.30am. My husband contacted reception and said it was not good enough, they told him that no other rooms were available. My husband insited that they moved us and they then managed to find another room!! It was now 2.30 in the morning! The room was a fairly good size but was was very dated and not too clean. The bathroom was a fair size but we had a hole in the bath!! The room was very noisy and everytime that the room above turned on their shower it sounded like a plane taking off, the hotel blammed this on the plumbing.
reviews.title: A long four days

reviews.text: The hotel was quite a way out and you had to catch the MRT to get anywhere as it was too warm to walk. We stayed in five cities whilst visiting Asia and this hotel was the worst by far!!
reviews.title: RUBBISH RUBBISH RUBBISH

reviews.text: We would not recommend this hotel and if we returned to Hong Kong would not stay here again.
reviews.title: CAN DO BETTER

reviews.text: Hello,
reviews.title: so helpful

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Average

likes.disliked: — Standard of rooms and their cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I selected this hotel as the price seemed reasonable for a City Hotel and it was quite near the Rugby Stadium.
reviews.title: Great base, great value hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positives are: The staff are extremely helpful and friendly but unfortunately don't always action your requests. It has a nice bar with a good atmosphere.
reviews.title: A good deal on HK Island

reviews.text: It is well placed to get to Wan Chai for night life, Central for shopping and the ferry terminals to go to Kowloon.
reviews.title: Nice, could use a little update

reviews.text: Most of the places you want to visit are no more than a £2 - £3 taxi ride away. The main lobby and eating areas are clean, smart and spacious.
reviews.title: Loved the location

description: Located on the edge of the bustling Causeway Bay shopping and business district, and within 5 minutes walk from Fortress Hill MTR station, the 613-room City Garden Hotel, Hong Kong is one of the best Hong Kong hotels, which provides complimentary shuttle bus services to nearby shopping and business hubs such as Taikoo Place and Cityplaza, which is only 10 minutes away. City Garden Hotel, Hong Kong has a variety of dining options, including the Michelin One Star Cantonese restaurant YUE, the Western and Asian favourite Garden Café, and the Singaporean and Malaysian restaurant Satay Inn.Whether it’s for business or relaxation, the City Garden Hotel, Hong Kong offers free WIFI and a comprehensive range of facilities, including an outdoor swimming pool, 24-hour gym, business centre, and meeting spaces.
